channel.description:
International recording artist, KB and respected writer and influencer, Ameen Hudson are best friends from the crazy streets of south side St. Petersburg, FL and share a distinct love for Jesus and for culture. 

Join them as they discuss important conversations on art, theology and Christian living from a unique perspective. 

You’ll never know what type of social commentary you’ll get from these dudes and their guests but we guarantee it to be full of substance, truth and “free smoke” for any controversy.

The Southside Rabbi podcast is presented by Native North.

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! In this dynamic episode, we sit down with legendary super-producer Rodney "Darkchild" Jerkins for an in-depth conversation on faith, family, and his journey through the music industry. Known for his iconic sound and impact on countless hits, Rodney shares insights on balancing life in the spotlight with his faith in Jesus and values. We also dive into his latest venture, Aliens Alive, and the vision behind his label that’s set to shape the future of CHH. Tune in for an inspiring conversation with one of the industry’s greats as he reflects on the highs, the challenges, and the calling that drives him to keep pressing.

item.description:
Southside Tribe! As the 2024 presidential election has come to a close, the uncertainty and tension that filled the air can morph into more uncertainty and tension. In this episode, recorded pre-election, we reflect on what it means to follow Jesus in a landscape where your favorite candidate may or may not have ended up in the oval office. Instead of being consumed by debates and disagreements, we invite our listeners to place their hope in Christ and focus on the timeless calling of discipleship. Together, let’s center our hearts on the unshakeable kingdom of God and live out our faith far beyond the ballot box. And, if you have found value in these conversations, please consider joining our Patreon community to help support this message of hope and truth.

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! In this special live episode recorded at the Legacy Conference in Miami, we explore the importance of grounding our Christian identity in Scripture rather than in the shifting tides of politics. Surrounded by a vibrant and diverse audience of believers, we discuss how scripture calls us to a higher allegiance beyond party lines or cultural divides, shaping our values, purpose, and ultimate identity. Join us as we unpack what it means to live out a Christ-centered life in today’s polarized world, embracing God as the "lion out of the cage". Peep this powerful conversation on remaining rooted in faith amidst political pressures, coming to you live from the heart and heat of Miami! Q&A session included!

item.description:
Southside!! In this eye-opening episode, we confront the reality of what it means for followers of Jesus to live as exiles in this world, especially within the divisive political landscape of America. We're joined by Dr. Preston Sprinkle, author of Exiles in Babylon and host of the Theology In the Raw podcast, as he shares his insights on how Christians can faithfully navigate cultural and political tensions without compromising their allegiance to Christ. Tune in as we explore what it means to be "in the world but not of it," embracing our identity as exiles while seeking to embody the values of the Kingdom of God.  Pull up for this conversation that challenges us to rethink our approach to politics and faith in a vastly polarized society.

item.description:
Southside Tribe! We are back again, just in time for the 2024 election szn. As the American presidential elections approach, many Christians wrestle with the question: "How should my faith influence my vote?" In this episode, we give a near-definitive answer on how to navigate the complex landscape of platforms, policies and pundits, while prioritizing values rooted in scripture. Join us as we unpack what it means to vote with a Christ-centered mindset, balancing issues of justice, morality, and the common good, as faithful followers of Jesus. Pull up!

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! In this last episode of Season 6, we delve into the Bible's teachings on the dangers of desiring wealth and the love of money. Spurred by the recent sentencing of Lamor "Bling Bishop" Whitehead to 9 years in prison, we look at the ways Scripture warns us that the pursuit of riches can lead to destructive paths, with the love of money being described as the root of all kinds of evil. Join us as we explore the profound wisdom behind these warnings and the impact of greed on our spiritual and moral lives. Through insightful discussion and biblical discourse, we uncover the true value of contentment in all things and placing our trust in God rather than material wealth. Tune in for a thought-provoking conversation on living a life free from the ensnaring grip of avarice. See you all next season!

item.description:
What's good, family?!! In this new episode, we once again tackle some of the perils of consuming and spreading conspiracy theories, shedding light on how these unfounded ideas may distort reality and incubate division. We also explore how casual social spaces like barbershops, can become hotbeds for misinformation and debate. Join us in this thoughtful dialogue, as we discuss the importance of godly discernment, critical thinking, and grounding our beliefs in scriptural truth and biblical insights. Additionally, we touch on how hurtful experiences can cause us to create conspiracies out of our relationships. Tune in for an eye-opening discussion on guarding our minds against falsehoods and maintaining integrity and wisdom in an age of rampant conspiracy.

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

item.title: Season 6 Episode 19: Conspiracy Theories Part 3: Barbershop

item.description:
Southside Tribe! Thank you for tuning in to our 100TH EPISODE!! In this compelling discussion, we examine the dangers of rap beef through the lens of biblical teachings, particularly the high-profile feud between Drake and Kendrick Lamar. While competition and rivalry are common in the music industry, the hostility that often accompanies these conflicts can escalate and lead to destructive outcomes. Join us as we explore how the principles of peace, manhood, and love in the Bible offer a healthier alternative to animosity and discord. We delve into the impact of such feuds on artists, fans, and the broader culture, urging listeners to embrace  harmony over division. Tune in for a thoughtful discussion on what happens when ideals collide, as we tread through this topic with grace and wisdom, inspired by timeless scriptural truths.

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

item.title: Season 6 Episode 18: K. Dot And Drizzy: When Ideals Collide

item.description:
Southside family!! We are back with another insightful episode as we dive into the pervasive influence of celebrity culture, both in mainstream society and within our communities of faith. From Hollywood icons to revered and respected figures in Christian circles, the temptation to idolize and downright deify individuals is ever-present. But as we wade through this topic, we uncover some of the inherent dangers of placing mere mortals on pedestals and the disillusionment that can closely follow when we equate giftedness and resources with righteousness or God's blessing. Through candid discussion and biblical insights, we challenge the notion that fame and success are indicators of divine favor, emphasizing the importance of humility and discernment in our pursuit of true spiritual growth. Tune in as we navigate the complexities of idolatry and uncover the path to genuine worship and reverence for Jesus. Hold onto your butts!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

item.title: Season 6 Episode 17: Celebrities For Jesus?: The Dangers of Fame

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! In this crucial new episode, we shine a light on the dangers of Christian nationalism (once again) and its impact on both faith and politics. From historical precedents to contemporary challenges, we explore how the fusion of religious identity with nationalistic fervor can distort the principles of Christianity and undermine Jesus's central message of love, humility and global vision. Join us as we dissect the ways in which some politicians can manipulate scripture and religious authority to advance personal agendas, and the ramifications this has on society at large. Join us as we defend the authentic teachings of the Bible and safeguard against the hijacking of faith for sociopolitical and financial gains. Tune in for a candid discussion on navigating the delicate balance between faith and civic responsibility in an increasingly polarized world.

item.itunes:summary:
Southside Tribe!! In this crucial new episode, we shine a light on the dangers of Christian nationalism (once again) and its impact on both faith and politics. From historical precedents to contemporary challenges, we explore how the fusion of religious identity with nationalistic fervor can distort the principles of Christianity and undermine Jesus's central message of love, humility and global vision. Join us as we dissect the ways in which some politicians can manipulate scripture and religious authority to advance personal agendas, and the ramifications this has on society at large. Join us as we defend the authentic teachings of the Bible and safeguard against the hijacking of faith for sociopolitical and financial gains. Tune in for a candid discussion on navigating the delicate balance between faith and civic responsibility in an increasingly polarized world.

item.title: Season 6 Episode 16: Christian Nationalism

item.description:
Southside Tribe, we baik!! In this enlightening episode, we delve into the complex and nuanced theological concept of original sin, and challenge common misconceptions surrounding the "innocence" of babies. While we believe the doctrine suggests that all humans are born with a sinful nature inherited from Adam, it's crucial to discern between inherent human weakness and deliberate sinful actions. Join us as we navigate through this theological landscape, exploring how the understanding of sin from birth doesn't necessarily equate to moral culpability. Through thoughtful discussion and biblical insights, we strive to unravel the nuances of human nature and emphasize the importance of God's love and grace, redemption, and discernment in our understanding of sin and righteousness.

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! We are back with another eye-opening convo as we explore the profound truth that the majority of Christian living unfolds outside of the church walls. Contrary to common perceptions, our mundane, everyday places, and tasks can serve as fertile grounds for organic gospel ministry. From the workplace to the neighborhood to the market, we have opportunities for organic gospel ministry. We explain how being impactful for Jesus is not exclusive to theologians, pastors, or missionaries but is, in fact, a call for every believer. Discover how ordinary moments can become extraordinary avenues for God's work, and how living out your faith in the world around you can be a transformative ministry in itself! Pull up!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, we are back! In this thought-provoking episode, we tackle the vital subject of diversity and inclusion from a biblical perspective, exploring the transformative changes it brings to our communities, workplaces and world. However, progress is not without resistance. Join us as we delve into the perspectives of those who oppose some of these changes, namely Charlie Kirk and Patriot Takes podcast, seeking to foster a constructive dialogue. Through this insightful discussion, we shed light on the importance of embracing diversity while highlighting its benefits, while not letting any side of the spectrum slide. Let's move towards a more inclusive world where everyone's voice is not just heard, but considered. And as always..hold onto your butts!

item.description:
Southside Tribe! We are back after the holiday festivities for another spicy one! In this episode, we delve into the complexities of modern manhood, primarily addressing the dangers associated with the "Manosphere" and exploring the rhetoric of its prominent figures like Andrew Tate. Join us as we navigate through these perspectives, offering insights grounded in scripture to encourage a balanced and thoughtful approach to manhood. It's time to reflect on what it truly means to be a godly man in today's world, embracing values that align with timeless biblical principles. Tune in for an enlightening discussion on forging a spiritual path to genuine and purposeful manhood, and hold onto your butts!!

We welcome back to the show, live and in person, Dr. Esau McCaulley, to discuss life and his newest riveting, powerhouse of a book, "How Far To The Promised Land: One Black Family's Story of Hope and Survival in the American South". Hear the heart behind the true memoir of this American family and how God showed himself strong in their lives. All of that, and Esau recanted on his grits statement from when he came on our show back in Season 2! Pull up!

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! This week we are back with a heavy-hitter, a sometimes widely debated topic: who's working, us or God? Here we discuss the "both-and" aspect of how God works in the world through us, and without us. We aren't instructed in Scripture to sit idly by, to hope and pray for some miraculous breakthrough (although those can happen). We have been instructed to work, and work as unto the Lord. Expect that convo and a whole lot more this week on Southside Rabbi!

item.description: Southside Tribe! We are back this week, resuming our 'Dangerous Jesus' series, walking through KB's debut book. KB has said 'Dangerous Joy' was his absolute favorite chapter to write, so much so, he wishes he could write an entire book on that very subject. Here we discuss the conundrum of the red tape placed all over God's world, by so many in the Church, and holiness over happiness. But for some reason, there is not much of work on how to use happiness FOR your holiness, in enjoying God's world. Pull up and rock with us!

item.description:
Southside Tribe! We are back with a sneak uppercut from the depths! This week we have our longtime friend, stylist, fashion designer, entrepreneur extraordinaire and biblical scholar, Caresse. Just one word, like Oprah. Join us and witness the grace that has been bestowed upon her life, her heart for those around her and her thriving thrifting business. We discuss our dependence on the Lord, the ease of just saying what you believe, and get insight into Dangerous Joy. We expound on the God of the Bible, the Greatest Designer, including how He enjoys his own creation, as it were, "singing about it", and how we are representations of that creative agency right here in His world. Pull up!

Contact Caresse here:
IG: http://instagram.com/revival.atl
Website: https://caressedionne.com

item.description:
Southside Tribe! We are back with Part 2 of Dangerous Justice, which is really an ongoing conversation we will be injecting throughout our episodes every now and again.  This time we are unpacking the virtue of Social Holiness, coined by John Wesley in regards to social justice in the Scriptures. We dive into the context of Micah 6, Matthew 25, and Job 31, where guidelines for the believer's love for neighbor in society are laid out. We also touch on the "new man" in Ephesians 2, ask the question, "who are the vulnerable among us?", and talk a bit on how God been God'ing out here! Come thru!

item.description:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome back to the Dangerous Jesus series! This week on Southside Rabbi, Dangerous Justice is up to bat, and it's a spicy one! Here we discuss complicated truths, uncomfortable realities, and diversified experiences. We address the elephant in the room of "segregated" worship spaces, as well as God's vision for the Church. We ask the questions, "is ignorance really bliss?", and "how close are allegiance and worship?". We also talk on Gen Z and Jesus, and Ameen gives a great breakdown of how fear drives culture wars. item.description:
What's good family!?! We are back with another installment in our "Dangerous Jesus" series (thank you to all who pre-ordered, shared and supported!!), surveying Chapter 3: Dangerous Gospel. Inside, we discuss the similarities between the Gospel and Geico, asking the question, is your gospel "good news" enough to compensate for the bitter "bad news" of the present? We also address what the good news was according to Jesus himself, and how the body of Christ and the Church should be a foretaste of the kingdom of God. We hear a story from the past of a gospel "lay-up" from KB, and Ameen shares thoughts on the popular retort "just shut up and preach the gospel", when issues of society and diversity are brought up. Hold on to your butts.

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, we are "baik" with another episode in our Dangerous Jesus series, this time touching on Dangerous Faith. We discuss righteousness over rhetoric, as many are unfortunately satisfied with good-talking, rather than good-living. We spend a good minute in 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 and it's context, as well as how to discern the spiritual "giants" among us. KB also shares the story of his mission trip to Liberia, and we get a hilarious lesson in the slang of Southside St. Pete! Come thru!

item.description:
Southside Tribe! We are back with a discussion on the troubling, unnecessary killing of another unarmed man, Tyre Nichols. You most likely have seen some news coverage of this tragic event, and as the story develops and unfolds, we at Southside Rabbi give some initial thoughts on the situation. We also dive into the history of policing in America, as well as some police reform examples and ideas. We touch on Romans 13, and the biblical call of local governing officials, and even hear the hearts of several police officers/detectives that KB knows personally. Strap in!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, we are back in the building this week with another controversial one for ya: why are so many people leaving the church, and in some cases Jesus himself? We do not claim to have all the answers, but by God's grace, we wade through the dense waters of this topic, from sources with articles and polls, personal experiences, and words from the mouths of others. We look at the book of James, talk inspiration vs. transformation, how we use our tongues, to all-out hypocrisy. If you or someone you know have left the Church for one reason or another, we implore you to be blessed by this episode. Hold onto your butts!

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! We are back with another hot one! This time our guy Scootie Wop joins us for some commentary on reconciliation, which includes healing AND forgiveness. We open with a few laughs (as usual) then move into deeper discussion on biblical forgiveness, and why we shouldn't cheapen it. We also take a look at Jesus' own words on forgiveness, and what it cost Him to earn our deliverance. We close with a glimpse into a time where Ameen and KB were not on good terms, and had to overcome it. If you've ever been hurt by, or have yourself hurt someone, you need to hear this. Pull up!

item.description: What's good, family?! Have you ever known anyone who suspected you might be an alien in disguise? Or swore up and down that the Earth is shaped like a frisbee? How about thinking Hillary is the Anti-Christ?! We are back with Part 2 of this very polarizing topic of conspiracy theories - approaching it biblically, culturally, and as always, hilariously! We knew we had to bring this topic back from Season 2, as conspiracies have been with us literally from the beginning, and they are not going anywhere, anytime soon. We discuss how to approach information, how to spot the difference between fact and opinion, and how to love those you know who may be drinking down conspiracies like water. Hold on to your butts!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, we back with another hitter! This week we are discussing something that troubles all of us one way or another: sin! We talk on root causes, spiritual therapy, taking action against sin early, and bringing our weaknesses TO God, rather than trying to keep them from Him. We also touch on Dane Ortlund's excellent book, Gentle and Lowly, that shows how the main disposition we see of Jesus in Scripture is that of a sympathizer and lover of the weak, the broken, the oppressed, the forgotten, and the sinner. Y'all please tell Dane he needs to come to the show! In addition to all that, this has to be the single most epic, legendary intro we have ever done! Hold on to your butts!!

Southside Tribe! Season 5 continues with another fantastic people for you! This week we have the industrious Ty Brasel, one of the hardest working CHH artists out there. Here we touch on the heart behind Ty's new album, his testimony, and overcoming adversity. KB shares how fighting through pain can be a catalyst for growth, and Ameen touches on remembering God's faithful promises whether in the midst of tribulations or abundance. We also have a special surprise for those watching the video: a sneak peek of Ty's 'HGA Sessions' performance, showcasing his new song, "ON THE RUN". Come witness the #BraselDazzle !!

One central question we seek to pose to our listeners here, with everything you are doing, teaching, subscribing to, loving, or hating, lifting up, or silencing: Who are you becoming? Southside Tribe! The wait is over! We are back in action with Season 5 on deck, and this episode is one for the ages! It's been a few months, so with all that's going on in the world, we circle back to the rise of Christian nationalism, the recent antics of Kanye West, and the Hebrew Israelite community. One central question we seek to pose to our listeners here, with everything you are doing, teaching, subscribing to, loving, or hating, lifting up, or silencing: Who are you becoming? In other words, what fruit is your life producing? Beatitudes or belligerence? Hold onto your butts!

Full episode on all audio platforms, video and bonus content on our Patreon community!!

item.description:
What up, Southside Tribe!! It's been a minute, but we still moving behind the scenes! This is a special bonus episode we recently shot with fellow recording artist S.O. Here we discuss the music industry and some tactics of major labels, Christian Hip-Hop, a bit of sync licensing, and the Kingdom ethic permeating everything we do! Be sure to check out S.O's new album "Now or Later", available wherever you get your music! Please enjoy! Season 5 coming soon!

item.description:
Y'all done up and done it! With Season 4 over with, we were out here resting, loving God and neighbor, gearing up for Season 5, when we got hit with the landmark news that the Supreme Court ruled Roe v. Wade overturned. Since then, we have received countless comments and DM's asking us to come down from the mountaintop, and address the people. Jokes aside, we are here with a special edition episode to give our takes, hot and cool, hoping to expand the vision of what pro-life really means, calling all of our listeners, whatever "side" of the decision you are on, to produce the fruit of the Spirit of God in your responses. We hope to encourage and prepare our churches for the work and effort that this decision actually entails. Let's get it!!

Full episode on all audio platforms, bonus content on our Patreon community!!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, what's good?! This week we are toning things down a bit, but the word is no less potent! We're sharing a bonus episode with you, and a very transparent and intimate one at that! We move from discussing the good theology of Job's friends, to the age-old question, "How do I actually know and feel that God loves me?", to emotional intelligence in the Church and in this world full of hardship. Y'all pull up and get comfortable!

Southside Tribe! This week we are back with more fantastic peoples! We have singer/songwriters Evan Craft and Sam Rivera, who recently released a song featuring KB entitled "Be Alright". Here we dive into their beginnings in the faith, the origins on the song, and how they ended up collaborating. Sam also shares his past battles with depression and mental health and how the Lord brought him through! Y'all pull up and get some of that gringo faith!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, what up?! We got a fantastic people for you this week! Our brother David French carved out some time to chat with us about the Christian call to justice and mercy, as well as sharing and breaking down one of his favorite passages of Scripture with us. We discuss the discrepancy between the early Christian Church's approach to engaging society as opposed to the nationalism and thirst for political power we see in today's times. Ameen also shares a story regarding his selection for the 2016 presidential candidate!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, y'all better stretch before listening to this joint! This week we have 2/3 of our sisters from the Truth's Table Podcast with us to discuss and breakdown some of their brand new debut book! And break it down they did! Dr. Christina Edmondson and Ms. Ekemini Uwan literally encouraged our souls by sharing their takes and burdens on colorism, anti-racism, forgiveness, singleness and marriage, misogyny, and biblical theology. In other words, there's something for errbody in here!! Their book releases April 26th, 2022, available at all major retailers, now available for pre-order. This episode is a must-hear! Hold onto your butts!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, salute!! We are back this week with one of the biggest stories in recent times: the incident between Chris Rock, Will Smith and Jada Pinkett at the 2022 Oscars. We keep it real, raw and nuanced as we navigate this situation from seemingly every angle imaginable. From what the Scriptures have to say (in context), to what would have proved better in the situation, to the real injuries that words can cause, and even the reality of women who struggle with various conditions and vulnerabilities. This is def one for the books! Bonus content from this episode available for our Patreon subscribers! Swing thru!

We dive into the Scriptures on several topics from suffering and daily encouragement, to success and God's grace! Ameen breaks down the trials Job encountered by God's hand, and ways Satan tries to tempt believers. KB also gives us insight on some ways fame and money can corrupt our hearts, if we allow them to rule over us, and shares a hilarious story, with a valuable lesson, about a traveling ritual he has with his sons. Pull all the way up!

item.description:
Ayye, Southside Tribe! We are back with another one! This week we are tackling a prevalent issue in the culture: the 'manoshpere', and 'manly man' ideology, especially as it relates to pride and degrading women, and seeing this through the lens of Scripture. We address the "alpha/beta male" mentality and speak on some of the roots of these terms. Come rock with us and hear what kind of servant leadership Christ Jesus modeled for us who follow Him!

item.description:
Hey family! This week the hits keep coming! After our illustrious intros, we acknowledge and briefly summarize the conflict in Ukraine, and segue into a discussion about burnout, for pastors, believers in Christ, and those still seeking Him. We also discuss the command from Jesus to not be alarmed, or anxious at the troubling times we see all around us. KB also shares a recent time he was close to burning out, as well as 3 practices Lecrae shared with him on the importance of rest. Stay tuned for a special surprise at the end!

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! We are back with another haymaker, speaking on dear brothers and sisters leaving their faith in Christ. We first touched on this topic back in Episode 9 of Season 1, and have revisited in light if recent events. There have been a slew of people, local and public figures, who have believed their doubts, taken their leave and left many around them full of questions. Most of y'all know that one of our mantras is "no easy answers", so with that being said, we sit and discuss the nuances of this difficult topic. God has not promised us "all the answers" to life's most difficult questions, here or in eternity. We apologize in advance for the audio! Come rock with us!

item.description:
Southside Tribe!! Welcome to Season 4! Thank y'all so much for rocking with us! We are back with a weighty and solemn conversation as we wade in the waters of the recent situation with a brother in the Lord, involving infidelity. As we pray for honesty of the heart and seek reconciliation for him and his spouse, we also see the opportunity to use our voices for exploited women everywhere, especially those of the household of faith. We discuss valuing and strengthening our sisters, as well as how the Bible shows us God's heart for women and wives. Click play and buckle up!

item.description:
Southside Tribe! We are still here! This week we are continuing the convo with big bro Ambassador, which was so weighty it deserved a second episode! Here we discuss some circumstances and mindsets that may have moved some of our dear friends and peers to the controversial belief system of 'Hebrew Israelism', more commonly heard as 'Black Hebrew Israelism', even people in our extended community. Here we discuss the Scriptures handed to us by the Apostles pertaining to God's love, ethnicity vs. circumcision of the heart, and the 'wall of hostility' that Christ Jesus has torn down by His work. Lots of y'all have been asking for this joint, so hold onto your butts for this incredible end to Season 3! Here's to 2022!!

item.description:
Yo, Southside Tribe! This week we got a 'fantastic people' for you! Yes, you read that right! We have our big bro William "The Ambassador" Branch, one of the most prominent founders of Cross Movement, and the Christian Hip Hop movement, in general! Here we salute our brother, who has discipled us and so many of our peers from a distance, and we catch up on his current position as Professor of Preaching and Bible at SEBTS, and prison ministry. We also get into the convo about the current state of Christian Hip Hop and where things may have shifted artistically, and KB asks the question, "Was Cross Movement unfaithful to and silent about the Social Justice conversation?" Strap in and hold on for Part one of this ride with Amba! Just in time for Christmas!

item.title: Season 3 Episode 13: "Ministry, Music, and The Justice Convo with The Ambassador" | Part One

item.description:
What's good, family?! This week we are back with a look at vigilantism, particularly in reference to the recent Rittenhouse and Arbery verdicts. KB shares several stories of personal experience, leading with the question: is it ego or is it danger, as the trend continues of civilians taking matters into their own hands, even after being instructed by professionals not to intervene. We also ask the question: in what ways should followers of Christ look different than the world in exercising our 2nd Amendment rights? Join us for this tough, nuanced conversation!

item.description:
Southside Tribe, what's good?! This week we are continuing mourning the recent death of fashion designer Virgil Abloh, and reflecting on eternity, asking the question: what does it really mean to gain the world, and lose your soul? We dive into the long-debated dichotomy of faith and works, discussing if they are really enemies, we touch on the work of disciplining your heart against default reactions that may not be godly. This is a rich one, y'all strap in!

Big bro Ruslan recently visited and sat with Ameen to discuss the "House of the Ritten" situation, as well as 2nd Amendment, NRA, and armed self-defense. item.description:
What's good, Southside Tribe! This week we've got the dynamic author, speaker and recording artist Maddie Rey! We know the presence of our godly and gifted sisters has been lacking our show, and there are many more to come! Here we discuss Maddie's background and upbringing in her father's church, the origins of her music career, and some of the pressures and expectations of being a woman in an often male-dominated space. What's good, family?! This week we are back with our 'first real pastor', Tommy Kyllonen of Crossover Church in Tampa! Southside Tribe, what's good?! This week we are bringing to y'all, for the second time, the entrepreneur extraordinaire, big bro Ruslan! item.description:
What's going on, family?! This week we sit down with the legendary Dr. Eric Mason. Y'all better strap in and hold onto your butts for this one! Here we talk with Dr. Mason about the origins of "deconstruction", or renovating faith, that has recently become a prevalent topic in Christian communities, especially in America. KB illustrates the importance of trusting God's promises and goodness, and Dr. Mason shows us where and how the first deconstruction happened in the Bible.

item.description:
What up, Southside Tribe!? This week we sit down with our brother Alex Castaneda, a Cuban rapper, activist, and follower of Christ. We discuss the past and present sociopolitical plight of the island of Cuba, as well as the story of Emelina Nunez, which Alex's last album was about. We touch on the arts, faith, culture, as well as recent comments from a particular group about an "embargo". Come rock with us as we seek to bear the burdens of our brothers and sisters, and be a voice for the voiceless!

item.description: Southside Tribe, y'all better buckle up for this one! This time around, we caught up with our guy, Dr. Neil Shenvi, aka Big Daddy Neil, aka The Muffin Man, and had a lively discussion about reconciliation, the gospel of Christ, concerns about CRT, and how some people use Dr. Shenvi's work as a weapon! As some of you may know, Dr. Shenvi is a figurehead praised (and not praised) by many in evangelical circles, and there are some ideas we challenge each other on via social media. This session was recorded in August 2020, and was originally intended as exclusive content for our patrons, but we've decided to release it as a 'bonus' episode for our extended audience. Enjoy!

In this episode, we have the dynamic tag team, Dr. Nathan Cartagena and Bradly Mason back with us to do a full-out masterclass on some primary sources, court cases, defining terms, responses to allegations, and all the while, pushing us to be Christ-like, merciful, and to seek the God of mercy Himself! Pull up Google and hold on tight!

item.description: What's going on, family?! Welcome back as we continue our series on critical race theory, to the glory of God! This time we are joined by our brother Dr. Nathan Luis Cartagena of Wheaton College, as he parses through some of his experiences as a Puerto Rican and Caucasian man in America, as well as his introduction to CRT. Dr. Cartagena also shares intimate details of his relationship with his Southern grandmother, who was raised and 'discipled ' in the Jim and Jane Crow era, as well as his desire for believers to depend on Holy Spirit to guide and shape us in ways that will make us better lovers of Christ and neighbor. Disclaimer: this is not an apologetic for CRT. We are not proponents of the discipline of Critical Theory, or any of its counterparts. We are defenders of truth, wherever it may be found. Hold on to your butts!!

item.description: What's going on, family?! This is Part 2 of our series engaging CRT to the glory of God, featuring our brother Bradly Mason, who has actually spoken with and studied several of the founders of CRT, and will prayerfully bring some clarity to this big mess of a "culture war" out here in the streets. Here we discuss much about Voddie Baucham's recent book 'Fault Lines', as well as the many misconceptions equating those thinking and talking about 'social holiness', with walking away from faith in Christ. Bradly also shares an exclusive story about how Ameen helped shape his own change of heart towards these issues years ago! Buckle up!

item.description: Southside Tribe, welcome to our series! If you've had your ear to the street in any regard, you have probably heard the term, Critical Race Theory. There is a recent push by the mainstream American church to demonize anything that concerns racism, white supremacy, or diversity, by calling it "CRT". And in doing so, they are grossly misrepresenting (in some cases, outright lying on) the scholars who originated the discipline. The purpose of this series is namely to inform the confused, and equip allies who see and understand Jesus' heart for the marginalized and oppressed in any society. Disclaimer: this is not an apologetic for CRT. We are not proponents of the discipline of Critical Theory, or any of its counterparts. We are defenders of truth, wherever it may be found. We are joined by brother Isaiah Thompson from Rapzilla for this first convo! Come rock with us!!

item.description:
What up, family?! We had an absolute blast catching up with our brother Tedashii recently. In this episode, we discuss the tragic loss of Tedashii's son Chase, the ongoing healing process, as well as the triumphs that have blossomed from this new-normal. We also touch on some of the pitfalls of the Christian music industry, dive in to God's Word, and the ambience of social media. Even so, the laughs and the soundboard are almost non-stop!

item.description:
What's up, family! Hold onto your butts as we debrief the aftermath of this wild and controversial election season, fraught with everything from political gang banging to voter fraud conspiracies. Pastor Sho 'N Go gives an overview of the State of the Union, KB has some sobering words for "cancel culture", and we address Romans 13 in honoring and praying for our elected leaders. Ameen closes with a heartfelt prayer that helps point the true believer to the Lord of all, as we keep it moving, as a nation and a people. 

Disclaimer: We, on Southside Rabbi, did not endorse or vote for either candidate.

item.description: What's going on, family! Continue holding onto your butts as we delve a bit further into the hot topics of politics in the life of believers, the inception of the "Evangelical" voting block, and abortion. In this upcoming election season, we want to continue to equip our listeners with the mind of Christ, who literally said, "My Kingdom is not of this world". So as we survey the landscape of our nation and engage numerous circles, let us see through the eyes of Jesus, and not simply a political stance. As always, thank you for rocking with us!

item.description: Are you or someone you know in danger of shipwrecked faith? Have our churches been infected with the "imma do me" mentality? The post-modern philosophies of our time have bled into many hearts in the Church, and we have recently seen many Christ-followers "turn back" in the name of "deconstruction" or exploring a different spiritual journey. KB and Ameen take the Word of God to this issue and keep it funky like always. Join us as we break down this unfortunate and all too common phenomenon.

item.description:
What would you say to the person guilty of murdering your brother? Would you seek vengeance or forgiveness? 

This week the nation was stunned by a remarkable display of the Gospel of grace. In this episode, KB and Ameen Hudson candidly unpack the history of the African American witness in the face of oppression and whether or not forgiveness undermines the pursuit and fight for justice.
